['Disagreement - A verbal or mental difference of opinion between two parties.', 'Argument - A heated exchange of opinions, often with raised voices and little resolution.', 'Compromise - An agreement reached by each party making concessions to settle a dispute.', 'Negotiation - ['Improve - To become better, more effective, or efficient over time.', 'Recover - The process of returning to normal after being hurt, sick, or damaged.', 'Repair - Fixing something that is broken or damaged so it works again.', "Rehabilitate - Restoring someone's physical or mental abilities and functions after illness or injury.", 'Bounce Back - To recover from a setback or difficult situation quickly.', 'Redress - Correct an unfairness, wrongdoing, or injustice by compensating for it.', 'Rectify - Fix or correct something that is wrong, mistaken, or damaged.', 'Revise - Make changes to something (like a document) in order to improve its accuracy and quality.', "Regenerate - To restore something's strength, vitality, or capacity through natural processes.", 'Rejuvenate - Give new energy, vigor, or enthusiasm to someone or something.', 'Renew - Make something better or more effective again; revitalize.', 'Restore - Return (something) to its original state after damage, loss, or deterioration.', 'Reinforce - Strengthen or support something by adding extra material or power.', 'Reverse - Turn back the clock on time, change direction, or undo an action.', 'Reclaim - Regain possession of (something) that was lost, stolen, or taken away.', 'Resume - Continue again after a pause; pick up where one left off.', 'Retrace - Go back over the same path or route.', 'Revitalize - Inject new life into something to make it more active, effective, and appealing.', 'Reinstate - Restore (something) to its former position or status.', 'Reinvent - Create a new version of something that already exists, especially in business, technology, or art.']
